com.esri.mo2.map.dpy
Interface SelectableLayer

All Superinterfaces:
Cloneable, Layer, Selectable
All Known Subinterfaces:
FeatureGraphicsLayer, FeatureLayer, GraphicsLayer
All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseFeatureGraphicsLayer, BaseFeatureLayer, BaseGraphicsLayer
public interface SelectableLayer
extends Layer, Selectable

An abstract Map Layer that supports a SelectionSet.

See Also:
Map, Selectable, Identifiable

Method Detail

setSelectable

public void setSelectable(boolean b)
Sets whether Data can be selected from a SelectableLayer.

Parameters:
b - true == selections can be made, false == otherwise

isSelectable

public boolean isSelectable()
Determines if Data can be selected from a SelectableLayer.

Returns:
true == selections can be made, false == otherwise
See Also:
setSelectable(boolean)

setSelectionSet

public void setSelectionSet(SelectionSet sset)
                     throws NotSelectableException
Sets the selected set of Features by specifying a SelectionSet.

Parameters:
sset - the new SelectionSet, null == same as calling clear()
Throws:
NotSelectableException - isSelectable == currently false

getSelectionSet

public SelectionSet getSelectionSet()
Returns the currently selected set of Data. This method is expected to return a copy of this SelectableLayer's current SelectionSet. Thus you cannot change a SelectableLayer's SelectionSet simply by changing the result of this method. In order to make a change, you must use setSelectionSet() once again.

Returns:
a copy of the SelectionSet
See Also:
setSelectionSet(com.esri.mo2.data.feat.SelectionSet)

setSelectedFeatures

public void setSelectedFeatures(QueryFilter query)
                         throws NotSelectableException
Sets the selected set of Data via a Query.

Parameters:
query - the definition of the selected set
Throws:
NotSelectableException - isSelectable == currently false

clear

public void clear()
           throws NotSelectableException
Clears the current selected set of features.

Throws:
NotSelectableException - isSelectable == currently false

getSelectableDataset

public Selectable getSelectableDataset()
Returns the underlying Selectable Dataset.

Returns:
the selectable dataset

select

public SelectionSet select(QueryFilter query)
Selects Data within this Layer's underlying Selectable Dataset. In the case of a GraphicsLayer, you must use a SpatialQueryFilter only, since the resulting selection set will be a set of 'elements', not 'features'.

Specified by:
select in interface Selectable
Parameters:
query - the query filter
Returns:
the resulting SelectionSet

hasSelectionSet

public boolean hasSelectionSet()
Returns whether or not this SelectableLayer has a SelectionSet or not

Returns:
true == this SelectableLayer has a SelectionSet, false == otherwise
